title: Vue JS
description: Vue.js, often referred to as Vue, is a progressive and popular JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications and interactive web applications.

body.raw:
Vue.js, often referred to as Vue, is a progressive and popular JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications and interactive web applications. Developed by Evan You and first released in 2014, Vue has gained widespread adoption among front-end developers due to its simplicity, flexibility, and a focus on component-based development. Here's a brief description of Vue.js: **Progressive Framework:** Vue is often described as a "progressive framework" because it can be incrementally adopted into existing projects. You can use as much or as little of Vue as needed, making it versatile for a wide range of applications. **Component-Based Architecture:** Vue promotes a component-based architecture, where the user interface is divided into reusable, self-contained components. Each component can have its own state, behavior, and template. **Declarative Rendering:** Vue uses a declarative approach to building user interfaces. Developers specify how the UI should look based on the current state, and Vue takes care of efficiently updating the DOM to match that desired state. **Two-Way Data Binding:** Vue provides two-way data binding, allowing changes in the UI to update the data and vice versa. This simplifies managing and synchronizing the state of your application. **Virtual DOM:** Similar to React, Vue uses a virtual representation of the Document Object Model (DOM) to optimize rendering performance. This helps minimize DOM manipulations and boosts application efficiency. **Directives:** Vue offers a set of built-in directives that enable declarative rendering and interaction. For example, you can use v-for for rendering lists and v-on for handling events. **Templates and JSX:** Vue supports both template-based and JSX-based syntax for defining components, providing flexibility to developers. **Large Ecosystem:** Vue has a rich ecosystem of libraries, tools, and extensions, including Vue Router for routing, Vuex for state management, and Vue CLI for project setup. **Community Support:** Vue has a growing and active community, which means access to a wealth of documentation, tutorials, and third-party components. **Integration:** Vue can be integrated with other libraries and frameworks, making it suitable for use with various technologies and for enhancing existing projects. Vue.js is commonly used for building modern web applications and is considered a competitive alternative to other JavaScript frameworks like React and Angular. Its simplicity and ease of use make it an attractive choice for both beginner and experienced developers. ## Example of code ```sh npm install -g @vue/cli ``` ```html Vue.js Counter Example
